DataElement.preferredName: Pregnancy Risk Assessment Monitoring System (PRAMS) Questionnaire Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it)._a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole._Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument._a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pregnancy Risk Assessment Monitoring System (PRAMS) Questionnaire
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it)._a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole._Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body, after union of an ovum and spermatozoon. (Dorland, 27th ed)

Concepts.definition: The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth.

Property.preferredDefinition: The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it).:a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.:Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.

Concepts.definition: The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it).
A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
